title: Edit a license model
content:
You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right.

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Software Asset > License Models.

  2. Select the license model record you want to edit.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button.

  3. Click the record identifier in the Id column to display the selected record.

  4. By default, the license model record is displayed with the General tab selected. Click the tab you want to edit or view.

    Tab Description
    General Displays details of the selected record.
    Workflow Displays the workflow for the model. To change the status to inactive, you must have the appropriate rights.
    Discussions Displays any relevant conversations about the current record.
    History Displays changes to the selected record.

  5. Save your changes.

General tab

Asset Model details

Field Description
Model type Type of model.
License metric

License metric of the license model. For example, by CPU.

Note: This field works only for the original SAM application. If you have enabled the new SAM capability, we recommend that you remove this field from the Forms tab page. This is because the new SAM capability has its own License metric field in the Software coverage section.
Display label External (common) name of the license model.
UNSPSC code Relevant UNSPSC code.
Brand Brand of the model.
Parent model Parent model of the selected license model record.
Owner Owner of the model.
Cost type Expense types from a financial perspective.
Category

If you select this option, the license model is a category. This enables you to categorize a group of license models in one theme.

  • If selected, this record doesn't appear as a selectable license model for licenses.
  • If not selected, this record does appear as a selectable license model for licenses.
Description Description of the asset model.
Review status The review status of the model, including pending, in progress, done, and rejected.
Reason The reason of creating the new license model.
Picture Click Upload image to upload a picture of the asset model.
Total amount

Cost of the model.

Available when: the Category option isn't selected.
Count per pack Number of licenses for a purchase pack.
Pack price Price for a pack.
Currency

Currency for the Total amount.

Available when: the Category option isn't selected.
Depreciation scheme Scheme on how the asset model is depreciated, such as linear, geometric, or sum of digits.
Depreciation duration The duration of depreciation (in months) for the selected asset model. The value that you specify must be a multiple of 12, such as 24, 36, or 48.
Depreciation rate

The rate that the asset model is to be depreciated.

Available when: the Geometric depreciation scheme is selected.

Software coverage

The Software coverage section is only applicable to the license asset model after enabling the new SAM capability.

Field Description
License metric

License metric used for compliance calculation. For example, by CPU.

To choose the correct license metric for the license model, we recommend that you manage licenses by publisher.
Product version

The version of the product. This field helps to build license pool information. SAM will learn about the product versions covered by a specific license. 

To add multiple products, click Add. For each product, you can only set one version. For cost-effectiveness, we recommend that you select the highest product version available for your license. 

To delete a product, click Remove.

SAM maintains the license compatibility matrix that describes how a license can transfer among different versions and editions. For more information, see License metrics.

Sub Asset Models

This section displays license asset models that are subordinate to the selected license asset model record.

Attachments

Click Add attachment if you want to attach a file to the record.

Note

  • The supported attachment file formats and the maximum file size of an attachment are defined in the tenant's Application settings tab in Suite Administration.
  • If the Attachments field has been defined as encrypted for this record type and you are a member of an encryption domain, click Add encrypted attachments to attach an encrypted file to the record.
  • Attachments aren't visible in the Service Portal.
